timeline.bodyText: Should be a Secret since it contains keys. Use stringData instead of data for secret
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Changed to Secret and utilized stringData
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't use always for checked in manifests. Can remove as it defaults to IfNotPresent
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: ConfigMap
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-config
+data:
+  application-yaml: |-
+    hedera:
+      mirror:
+        test:
+          acceptance:
+            messageTimeout: 60s
+            nodeId: 0.0.3
+            nodeAddress: testnet
+            mirrornodeAddress: hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:5600
+            operatorid:
+            operatorkey:
+            existingTopicNum:
+            emitBackgroundMessages: true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+spec:
+  completions: 1
+  parallelism: 1
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+    spec:
+      restartPolicy: Never
+      containers:
+        - image: gcr.io/mirrornode/hedera-mirror-test:0.13.0-rc1
+          imagePullPolicy: Always

replies.bodyText: Removed. Left over from frequent pre-master merge pushes

timeline.bodyText:
Should add pod anti affinity rules to schedule pods on different nodes:
affinity:
  podAntiAffinity:
    preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      - weight: 100
        podAffinityTerm:
          topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
          labelSelector:
            matchLabels:
              app.kubernetes.io/name: test

timeline.bodyText: This is a bit strange. Does an application.yaml pick up if you put it in /usr/etc/hedera-mirror-node/hedera-mirror-test/ instead? Placing file within codebase seems wrong. Consider using SPRING_CONFIG_ADDITIONAL_LOCATION env variable to configure path outside of codebase.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: ConfigMap
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-config
+data:
+  application-yaml: |-
+    hedera:
+      mirror:
+        test:
+          acceptance:
+            messageTimeout: 60s
+            nodeId: 0.0.3
+            nodeAddress: testnet
+            mirrornodeAddress: hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:5600
+            operatorid:
+            operatorkey:
+            existingTopicNum:
+            emitBackgroundMessages: true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+spec:
+  completions: 1
+  parallelism: 1
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+    spec:
+      restartPolicy: Never
+      containers:
+        - image: gcr.io/mirrornode/hedera-mirror-test:0.13.0-rc1
+          imagePullPolicy: Always
+          name: publish-test-img
+          env:
+            - name: testProfile
+              value: "acceptance"
+            - name: cucumberFlags
+              value: "@PublishOnly"
+          volumeMounts:
+            - name: publish-config-volume
+              mountPath: /usr/etc/hedera-mirror-node/hedera-mirror-test/src/test/resources/application-default.yml

timeline.bodyText: Name the key in ConfigMap as application-default.yaml then you don't need this items section and subPath in volumeMounts
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: ConfigMap
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-config
+data:
+  application-yaml: |-
+    hedera:
+      mirror:
+        test:
+          acceptance:
+            messageTimeout: 60s
+            nodeId: 0.0.3
+            nodeAddress: testnet
+            mirrornodeAddress: hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:5600
+            operatorid:
+            operatorkey:
+            existingTopicNum:
+            emitBackgroundMessages: true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+spec:
+  completions: 1
+  parallelism: 1
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+    spec:
+      restartPolicy: Never
+      containers:
+        - image: gcr.io/mirrornode/hedera-mirror-test:0.13.0-rc1
+          imagePullPolicy: Always
+          name: publish-test-img
+          env:
+            - name: testProfile
+              value: "acceptance"
+            - name: cucumberFlags
+              value: "@PublishOnly"
+          volumeMounts:
+            - name: publish-config-volume
+              mountPath: /usr/etc/hedera-mirror-node/hedera-mirror-test/src/test/resources/application-default.yml
+              subPath: application-default.yml
+      volumes:
+        - name: publish-config-volume
+          configMap:
+            defaultMode: 0555
+            name: hcs-perf-publish-config
+            items:
+              - key: application-yaml

replies.bodyText: Made the key change and removed the items section. Removing subPath under volumeMounts causes properties file not to be found by spring on test run
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
A container level securityContext would be good so we're not running as root (same level as env):
securityContext:
  capabilities:
    drop: [ALL]
  readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
  runAsGroup: 1000
  runAsNonRoot: true
  runAsUser: 1000
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this file is useful. It's not runnable as is and is quite a bit of config to get right. Would be better to just keep the concrete test cases that need minor tweaking to IPs, keys, etc.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -181,25 +209,96 @@ The initial jmx test plan files under `hedera-mirror-test/src/test/jmeter/` foll
 4.  DB_Cleanup_Sampler - Cleans up the db
     -   (See DB_Setup_Sampler options)
 
+> **_Note:_** Subscribe_Only tests only cover section 3. No db operations are carried out.
+
+
 # 3 Containerized Run
 
 The hedera-mirror-test module offers a containerized distribution of the [acceptance](#acceptance-test-execution) and [performance](#performance-test-execution) tests.
 
-## Image creation
+## Kubernetes Cluster Run
+
+The repo provides a default Kubernetes [Job](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/job/) and [ConfigMap](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/configmap/) spec template in a single file under `hedera-mirror-test/src/test/resources/k8s/run-test.yml`
+Running this file as follows will deploy a Kubernetes [pod](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod/) with a container that runs the acceptance or performance tests in the cloud.
+
+    kubectl apply -f hedera-mirror-test/src/test/resources/k8s/run-test.yml

timeline.bodyText: This label does not match the label in the affinity, making affinity non-effective. This one should be app.kubernetes.io/name as it is the standard label.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: ConfigMap
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-subscribe-config
+data:
+  user-props: |-
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.host=hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.port=5600
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientCount=1
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.sharedChannel=false
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientTopicId[0]=47020
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientStartTime[0]=
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientEndTime[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientLimit[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientRealmNum[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientHistoricMessagesCount[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientIncomingMessageCount[0]=10
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientSubscribeTimeoutSeconds[0]=60
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientMilliSecWaitBefore[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientUseMAPI[0]=true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-subscribe-test
+  labels:
+    app.kubernetes.io/name: test
+spec:
+  completions: 3
+  parallelism: 3
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-subscribe-test
+      labels:
+        app: test

timeline.bodyText: This label does not match the label in the affinity, making affinity non-effective. This one should be app.kubernetes.io/name as it is the standard label.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: Secret
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-secret
+stringData:
+  application-default.yml: |-
+    hedera:
+      mirror:
+        test:
+          acceptance:
+            messageTimeout: 60s
+            nodeId: 0.0.3
+            nodeAddress: testnet
+            mirrornodeAddress: hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:5600
+            operatorid:
+            operatorkey:
+            existingTopicNum:
+            emitBackgroundMessages: true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+  labels:
+    app.kubernetes.io/name: test
+spec:
+  completions: 1
+  parallelism: 1
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-publish-test
+      labels:
+        app: test

timeline.bodyText:
As mentioned, you don't need items. Just name your key in secret as user.properties. Likewise you don't need subpath in mount as by default it will mount all files in secret in dir:
volumeMounts:
- name: subscribe-config-volume
  mountPath: /usr/etc/hedera-mirror-test
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: ConfigMap
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-subscribe-config
+data:
+  user-props: |-
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.host=hcs.testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.port=5600
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientCount=1
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.sharedChannel=false
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientTopicId[0]=47020
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientStartTime[0]=
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientEndTime[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientLimit[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientRealmNum[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientHistoricMessagesCount[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientIncomingMessageCount[0]=10
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientSubscribeTimeoutSeconds[0]=60
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientMilliSecWaitBefore[0]=0
+    hedera.mirror.test.performance.clientUseMAPI[0]=true
+---
+apiVersion: batch/v1
+kind: Job
+metadata:
+  name: hcs-perf-subscribe-test
+  labels:
+    app.kubernetes.io/name: test
+spec:
+  completions: 3
+  parallelism: 3
+  template:
+    metadata:
+      name: hcs-perf-subscribe-test
+      labels:
+        app: test
+    spec:
+      affinity:
+        podAntiAffinity:
+          preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
+            - weight: 100
+              podAffinityTerm:
+                topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
+                labelSelector:
+                  matchLabels:
+                    app.kubernetes.io/name: test
+      restartPolicy: Never
+      containers:
+        - image: gcr.io/mirrornode/hedera-mirror-test:0.13.2
+          name: test
+          env:
+            - name: testProfile
+              value: "performance"
+            - name: subscribeThreadCount
+              value: "4"
+            - name: jmeter.test
+              value: "E2E_Subscribe_Only.jmx"
+          volumeMounts:
+            - name: subscribe-config-volume
+              mountPath: /usr/etc/hedera-mirror-node/hedera-mirror-test/user.properties
+              subPath: user.properties
+      volumes:
+        - name: subscribe-config-volume
+          configMap:
+            defaultMode: 420
+            name: hcs-perf-subscribe-config
+            items:

replies.bodyText: Fixed. My issue was not using a directory outside of the repo source
replies.author: Nana-EC
